resources.name: 1. Create Chat
resources.description:
Create a new chat session ‚Üí saves chat_id
Returns 201 on success, 409 if duplicate title exists

resources.name: 2. List Chats
resources.description:
Get all chats for a project (ordered by updated_at DESC)
Returns empty array [] if no chats found

resources.name: 3. Get Chat by ID
resources.description:
Retrieve a specific chat ‚Üí refreshes chat_id
Returns 404 if chat not found or deleted

resources.name: 4. Update Chat Title
resources.description:
Rename a chat (updates updated_at automatically)
Returns 409 if new title conflicts with existing chat

resources.name: 5. Delete Chat (Soft)
resources.description:
Soft-delete a chat (sets deleted_at timestamp)
Returns the deleted chat with deleted_at populated
Deleted chats won't appear in list/get queries

resources.name: 1. Create Root Turn (User)
resources.description:
Create first turn in conversation (prev_turn_id = null)
Role: 'user', with text content block
Returns 201 with turn_id ‚Üí saves to environment

resources.name: 2. Create Child Turn (Assistant) [DEBUG ONLY]
resources.description:
Create an assistant turn using the debug-only endpoint
Role: 'assistant' for AI response

DEBUG ENDPOINT: POST /debug/api/chats/:id/turns
Only available when ENVIRONMENT=dev

Phase 1 (Current): This debug endpoint allows manual assistant turn creation for testing.
Phase 2 (Streaming): Use streaming requests instead - user turns trigger automatic assistant streaming.

Production: This endpoint does NOT exist (returns 404)

resources.name: 3. Create Branch Turn
resources.description:
Branch conversation from assistant_turn_id
Creates alternative path in conversation tree
Multiple children = multiple branches

resources.name: 4. Get Turn Path (Root to Turn)
resources.description:
Get full conversation path from root to specified turn
Returns turns in order: [root, child, grandchild, ...]
Used to build LLM context in Backend 4

resources.name: 5. Get Turn Children (Branches)
resources.description:
Get all child turns (branches) from a parent turn
Returns array of turns (empty [] if no children)
Used to display branching UI

resources.name: 1. Turn with Text Content
resources.description:
User turn with simple text content block
Most common content type

resources.name: 2. Turn with Document Reference
resources.description:
User turn referencing entire document
Includes ref_id (document UUID) and ref_type

resources.name: 3. Turn with Partial Reference
resources.description:
User turn with text selection from document
Includes selection_start/end and copied text_content

resources.name: 4. Turn with Multiple Blocks
resources.description:
Complex turn with mixed content types
Blocks are stored in sequence order

resources.name: 1. Turn with Temperature
resources.description:
Test temperature and max_tokens parameters
Validates request_params storage in database
Higher temperature = more creative/random responses

resources.name: 2. Turn with Thinking (Low)
resources.description:
Test thinking mode with low budget (2000 tokens)
Should see thinking blocks in response
Thinking level: low = 2K, medium = 5K, high = 12K tokens

resources.name: 3. Turn with Thinking (High)
resources.description:
Test thinking mode with high budget (12000 tokens)
Allows for more extensive reasoning
Compare thinking block length vs low budget test

resources.name: 4. Turn with Top-P and Top-K
resources.description:
Test sampling parameters
top_p: Nucleus sampling threshold (0.0-1.0)
top_k: Limits vocabulary to top K tokens

resources.name: 5. Turn with Custom Model
resources.description:
Test model override via request_params
Overrides default model (claude-haiku-4-5)
Response.model should match requested model

resources.name: 6. Turn with Stop Sequences
resources.description:
Test stop sequences parameter
Generation stops if any sequence is encountered
Useful for structured outputs or control flow

resources.name: 7. [VAL] Invalid Temperature Range
resources.description:
Test validation: temperature out of range
Valid range: 0.0 - 2.0
Expect: 400 Bad Request with validation error

resources.name: 8. [VAL] Invalid Thinking Level
resources.description:
Test validation: invalid thinking_level value
Valid values: 'low', 'medium', 'high'
Expect: 400 Bad Request with validation error

resources.name: 1. Create User Turn (Triggers Streaming)
resources.description:
Create user turn ‚Üí automatically triggers assistant streaming

NEW BEHAVIOR (Streaming):
- Creates user turn (status='complete')
- Creates assistant turn (status='streaming')
- Returns BOTH turns in response
- Client can immediately connect to stream_url

RESPONSE:
{
  "user_turn": { "id": "...", "status": "complete" },
  "assistant_turn": { "id": "...", "status": "streaming" },
  "stream_url": "/api/turns/:id/stream"
}

resources.name: 2. Stream Turn (SSE)
resources.description:
Connect to Server-Sent Events stream for real-time turn deltas

EVENT FLOW:
1. turn_start - Streaming begins
2. block_start - New content block
3. block_delta - Incremental text updates (many)
4. block_stop - Block completed
5. turn_complete - Turn finished

RECONNECTION:
- If disconnected, reconnect to same URL
- Will receive block_catchup events for completed blocks
- Then continues with live deltas

Insomnia will display events in real-time.
Keep this request open to continue receiving events.

resources.name: 3. Get Turn Blocks (Reconnection)
resources.description:
Fetch all completed turn blocks

USE CASES:
1. Reconnection - Get blocks after SSE disconnection
2. Polling - Check progress while streaming
3. Final state - Get complete content after turn_complete

Returns array of TurnBlock objects:
- sequence (0-indexed order)
- block_type (text, thinking, tool_use, etc.)
- text_content (for text/thinking)
- content (JSONB for block-specific data)

resources.name: 4. Interrupt Turn
resources.description:
Cancel an in-progress streaming turn

BEHAVIOR:
- Cancels the TurnExecutor
- Updates turn status to 'cancelled'
- Closes SSE streams for all connected clients
- Partial blocks are saved to database

ONLY WORKS:
- While turn is actively streaming (status='streaming')
- Returns 404 if turn not found in executor registry

RESPONSE:
{
  "success": true,
  "turn_id": "...",
  "status": "cancelled"
}

resources.name: 5. Stream Already Complete Turn
resources.description:
Test reconnection to a turn that already finished streaming

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
- If turn status = 'complete': Immediate turn_complete event
- If turn status = 'error': Immediate turn_error event
- If turn status = 'streaming': Normal streaming flow

USE turn_id (not assistant_turn_id) to test with older completed turns

resources.name: 6. Get Blocks (User Turn)
resources.description:
Test fetching blocks from a user turn

EXPECTED:
- Returns blocks for user turn (the input message)
- Should have text_content with user's message

Compare with assistant turn blocks to see streaming results

resources.name: 7. Get Blocks (Assistant Turn)
resources.description:
Test fetching blocks from a assistant turn

EXPECTED:
- Returns blocks for assistant turn (the output message)
- Should have text_content with assistant's message

Compare with user turn blocks to see streaming results

resources.name: Workflow: Create Chat ‚Üí Turn ‚Üí Get Path
resources.description:
Full workflow demonstrating typical usage:
1. Create chat
2. Add user turn
3. Get conversation path

Run sequentially to test complete flow

resources.name: Test with Seeded Data
resources.description:
Get the seeded chat created by `make seed`
ID: 11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
Contains 8 turns demonstrating branching conversation tree

resources.name: Invalid project_id
resources.description:
Attempt to create chat with non-existent project
Expect: 404 Not Found

resources.name: Invalid prev_turn_id
resources.description:
Attempt to create turn with non-existent parent
Expect: 404 Not Found

resources.name: Missing required fields
resources.description:
Attempt to create chat without title
Expect: 400 Bad Request with validation error

resources.name: Invalid role value
resources.description:
Attempt to create turn with invalid role
Expect: 400 Bad Request (must be 'user' or 'assistant')

resources.name: Invalid content block type
resources.description:
Attempt to create turn with invalid block_type
Expect: 400 Bad Request (must be text/image/reference/partial_reference)
